title: Module 4
description: This quiz teaches how to stay safe online by recognizing scams, protecting passwords, avoiding dangerous links, and understanding common online threats that can steal money or personal information.

questions.question: What is a financial scam?
options: A trick to steal your money or information
questions.explanation: A financial scam is designed to trick people into giving away money or personal information.

questions.question: Why should you never share passwords?
options: Someone could steal your accounts or money
questions.explanation: Sharing passwords can allow someone to access your accounts, steal your money, or misuse your personal information.

questions.question: Which is a sign something might be a scam?
options: It promises huge rewards very fast
questions.explanation: Scams often promise fast, unrealistic rewards to trick people into giving away money or information.

questions.question: Why be careful with “get rich quick” offers?
questions.explanation: Most 'get rich quick' offers are scams designed to take your money or personal details.

questions.question: Which message is most likely a scam?
options: A text from your friend asking to hang out
A message saying you won a prize you didn’t enter
A message from an app you installed
questions.explanation: Scammers often claim you won something to get your attention, even when you never signed up for a contest.

questions.question: Why should you avoid clicking on random links online?
options: They take too long to load
They could lead to fake websites that steal your information
questions.explanation: Scammers create fake websites that look real. Clicking unknown links can expose your private information or install harmful software.

questions.question: Why is it important to use strong passwords?
options: Because strong passwords make it harder for hackers to break into your accounts
Because apps force you to use them
questions.explanation: A strong password protects your accounts from hackers. You should also use multi-factor authentication whenever possible for extra security.

questions.question: Which of the following is a safe online behaviour?
options: Sharing your login details with a friend
Responding to strangers who message you about money
questions.explanation: Keeping personal information private protects you from scammers and identity theft.
